config_description: Compression to apply to the commit log. If omitted, the commit log will be written uncompressed.  LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate compressors are supported.
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'commitlog_compression' configuration is used to specify the compression algorithm to apply to the commit log. The code initializes a Configuration object with the value of DatabaseDescriptor.getCommitLogCompression(), which presumably returns the selected compression algorithm (LZ4, Snappy, Deflate, or none for uncompressed). This configuration is then used when writing to the commit log.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration depends on when the CommitLog class is instantiated or when the resetConfiguration method is called. The configuration is set during CommitLog initialization and can be reset for testing purposes.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration option on the system is related to the size of the commit log files. Using compression can reduce the size of the commit log files, potentially saving disk space and improving I/O performance. However, the choice of compression algorithm can also impact CPU usage and write performance.
